column9: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Unique Users)
column10: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through unpaid distribution. (Unique Users)
column11: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Unique Users)
column12: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Total Count)
column13: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's posts entered a person's screen through unpaid distribution. (Total Count)
column14: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Total Count)
column15: Lifetime: The number of unique people who engaged in certain ways with your Page post, for example by commenting on, liking, sharing, or clicking upon particular elements of the post. (Unique Users)
column16: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting that clicked anywhere in your post on News Feed. (Unique Users)
column17: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in your post on News Feed from the user that matched the audience targeting on it. (Total Count)
column18: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post. (Unique Users)
column19: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post. (Total Count)
column20: Lifetime: The number of impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column21: Lifetime: The number of people who saw your Page post because they've liked your Page (Unique Users)
column22: Lifetime: The number of paid impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column23: Lifetime: The number of people who like your Page and who saw your Page post in an ad or sponsored story. (Unique Users)
column24: Lifetime: The number of people who have liked your Page and clicked anywhere in your posts. (Unique Users)
column25: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column26: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column27: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column28: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column29: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column30: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column31: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column32: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column33: Lifetime: Average time video viewed (Total Count)
column34: Lifetime: Length of a video post (Total Count)
column35: Lifetime: The number of unique people who created a story about your Page post by interacting with it. (Unique Users)
column38: Lifetime: The number of stories created about your Page post, by action type. (Total Count)
column41: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting on the post that clicked anywhere in the post on News Feed, by type. (Unique Users)
column45: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in the post on News Feed from users that matched the audience targeting on the post, by type. (Total Count)
column49: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post, by type. (Total Count)
column51: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post, by type. (Unique Users)

column3:
The Exquisite Corpse is now available to stream! Created by Abby Pierce and Cassidy SM.

Welcome to the "The Exquisite Corpse," a DIY artists collective in Chicago comprised of five wildly different personalities; from their disciplines to their appetites, their personal histories to their dishwashing habits. It's a colorful and eccentric shared space, where the drive for generating radical and loving work is only mitigated by the fact that humans live there, with all the realities that come with that like: hygiene, personal space, and oh yeah, rent. #ExquisiteCorpseDIY

In Episode 2 of VELVET, an open mic teaches us that there is more to Demetra than meets the eye. 

Episodes 1-3 of Velvet Web Series are now available! 

When Demetra, a competitive professional, is forced to reevaluate her social life, she strikes up a friendship with Cymone, her seemingly much cooler coworker. As their worlds collide to form a brand new #squad, these five young Chicagoans begin to reevaluate their own identities as well as their relationships to each other. By weaving together public and private experiences, VELVET comedically explores the joys, vulnerabilities, and everything-in-between of making new friends in your mid-twenties. 

Created by Allie Dunn, Leo Gilbert, Dru Greenwood, Tyla Landry, Sydney Levison, Clifton Lyons, and Becky Schultz. 
#VELVETWebseries

Part one of #ExquisiteCorpseDIY is now LIVE! The series is created by Abby Pierce and Cassidy SM.

Chicago based artist co-op, "The Exquisite Corpse," has one week to come up with rent on threat of eviction. When the roommates decide to throw a huge "let's make-rent" arts fundraiser at the end of the week, all four roommates (Lee, Lizzard, Tre, and Sam) go into a frenzy trying to organize an event that will go down in DIY history. Amidst the chaos, Sam's yuppie sister, Dusty, seeks asylum from her quarter life-crisis spurred by on by the death of her dog Paul. Sam and Tre try to navigate the world of polyamory vs. monogamy, Lee begins a career as a drag queen, and Lizzard falls in love with an unexpected person. The Exquisite Corpse follows one week in the lives of these disparate personalities, with shifting perspectives, as they try to navigate love, family, art, and the acute need to make rent.

Sign up for the newsletter to be the first to know when more #ExquisiteCorpseDIY is available: weareo.tv/program
The creators of Brown Girls are LIVE on Facebook now!

Episodes 1-3 of Velvet Web Series are now available! 

#VELVETWebseries is a comedic and earnest new web series, based on a true story, exploring the ups and downs of making new friends in your twenties. The series is created by Allie Dunn, Leo Gilbert, Dru Greenwood, Tyla Cymone Landry, Sydney Levison, Clifton Lyons, and Becky Schultz.

#weareotv
Q&A with some of the Velvet Web Series  and #ExquisiteCorpsediy creators !

TONIGHT!

What’s the T with OTV - 2017 Development Report

Get an exclusive look behind the curtain with this report from OTV founder and Head of Development Aymar Jean Christian. 
Dig in for the scoop on our rebrand, 2017 #OTVoriginals, 2017 #OTVpresents, all the T on that coin, where OTV showed out across the country and beyond, lessons learned and more.

Thank you WDCB News's The Arts Section by Gary Zidek for this story on OTV, #theTTV, and Velvet Web Series, premiering Wednesday! 

"I saw a need for a platform that specifically focused on people who were excluded from Hollywood, so thinking not just about representing black people, not just representing queer people, or not just representing Asian people, but all of those identities together" - Dr. Aymar Jean Christian on the inspiration for Open Television.

RSVP for the Velvet premiere: OTV Presents: The Exquisite Corpse & Velvet Premiere

It's true- join us this #OTVWednesday at the Chicago Cultural Center for the premiere of the first 3 episodes of Velvet Web Series and the premiere of the #ExquisiteCorpseDIY ! 

Check out the facebook event for updates and the Eventbrite link to RSVP: OTV Presents: The Exquisite Corpse & Velvet Premiere.

Welcome to the "The Exquisite Corpse," a DIY artists’ collective in Chicago comprised of five radically different personalities; from their disciplines to their appetites, their personal histories to their dishwashing habits. It's a colorful and eccentric shared space, where the drive for generating radical and loving work is only mitigated by the fact that humans live there, with all the realities that come with that like hygiene, personal space, sex, and, oh yeah, rent.

The Exquisite Corpse is created by Abby Pierce and Cassidy Slaughter-Mason. See the premiere March 28th: 
OTV Presents: The Exquisite Corpse & Velvet Premiere

Thank you to all that made it out to see Brujos on Wednesday! You can watch all episodes of #BrujosTV right now here: http://www.weareo.tv/originals/brujos

Make sure you RSVP to our next #OTVWednesday where we will be showing the premieres of #ExquisiteCorpseDIY and Velvet Web Series. 

RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/otv-presents-the-exquisite-corpse-velvet-premiere-tickets-43488380918

"Brujos isn’t about people of color or queer people of color succeeding or finding love in the normative world. It’s about them taking that world down and living their lives effectively in the antimatter of white supremacy and heteropatriarchy." - Creator Ricardo Gamboa for Out Magazine. 

See the entire first season tonight FREE at the Chicago Cultural Center in Claudia Cassidy Theater. Please RSVP: http://bit.ly/2ICwa0d

#OTVWednesdays

Tomorrow from 6-8pm join us for the first Chicago screening of the ENTIRE first season of Brujos, a series created by Ricardo Gamboa and co-directed by Reshmi Hazra Rustebakke that follows four gay Latino grad students who are also witches. 

As always, attendance is free, please RSVP: http://bit.ly/2ICwa0d

So many #OTVCommunity series at this dope event tomorrow ! Tickets are $10: http://bit.ly/2ppsGFn

With the launch of Showtime’s The Chi and HBO’s upcoming Brown Girls, Chicago is emerging as a hotbed of new, exciting and racially diverse content. This collection of new Chicago-based web series shows an eclectic and fun array of stories about LGBTQ individuals, women, and people of color: Bea Cordelia Sullivan-Knoff and Daniel Kyri Madison's heartfelt the T and Zak Payne endearing Kissing Walls both examine love and relationships in the LGBTQ community; while Wendy Jo Carlton’s Easy Abby follows the comic exploits of a Chicago lesbian; Velvet Web Series tells the story of two very different black women in all black office, and Addison Heimann’s Kappa Force is the rollicking story of five diverse superhero sorority ladies investigating the murder of their youngest member.

Now presenting: YOGMA! All episodes are available to watch at weareo.tv/originals/yogma

Yogma tells the story of a hopeful, young yoga instructor who dreams of being a bright star in a beautiful culture and finds out that her rise to the top and the world she's fighting to be a part of... aren't exactly what she thought they'd be.

Created by Karla Huffman.

#womenshistorymonth

YOGMA is now LIVE on weareo.tv! Watch the entire season here: 
https://vimeo.com/album/5048675/video/260143645

Yogma tells the story of a hopeful, young yoga instructor who dreams of being a bright star in a beautiful culture and finds out that her rise to the top and the world she's fighting to be a part of... aren't exactly what she thought they'd be. 

Created by Karla Huffman.

Video by Vasilios Papapitsios.

#BSAYF by Chicago-based artist Roy Kinsey premieres on Billboard! Kinsey tells the magazine: https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/pride/8244842/roy-kinsey-interview

"I wanted to visually show a story from dark to light. So from this point of conflict to redemption. So we did that with colors, I chose colors to focus on in every scene, but I always wanted it to be that I was this soothsayer or this prophet that could see it all. So that’s where this ancestral realm kind of comes from. I [also] wanted to bring some light and humor to this betrayal that can be very dark and devastating experience. Plus I wanted to tap into myself and sort of this inner knowing of like “you know and you decided to ignore these red flags that were popping up because you were so desperate to have ‘a friend.’"

It's like Maya Angelou says: when somebody tells you who they are, believe them. But also in the video when she goes through the healing process, because she does heal, that’s her tapping into the divine feminine energy that we all have inside of ourselves."

BSAYF will be featured in OTV's upcoming pilot "Hair Story." Catch a sneak peek at the The Art Institute of Chicago March 30. Details here: http://www.artic.edu/event/gallery-talk-and-screening-artists-connect-open-tv

Seeds Series is now LIVE on weareo.tv! 

Centered around the friendship of four college-aged girls, Seeds is a bold and dynamic narrative that explores the conversations between them through a hilariously authentic lens. Created by Deja Harrell and C.J. Thomas.

We're kicking off #OTVwednesdays with the premieres of these two hilarious shows, both created by black women. 

#Seedsseries is a comedic, socially conscious web series from Deja Harrell, following the misadventures of four young black women.

#Yogma follows a hopeful, young yoga instructor who dreams of being a bright star in a beautiful culture finds out that her rise to the top, and the world shes fighting to be a part of... aren't exactly what she thought they'd be. Series created by Karla Huffman. (Gypsy Yoga)

It all goes down tonight at 6pm!
#OTVTonight at the Museum of Contemporary Art 03/06/18

What do students think about during yoga class? Enjoy this teaser from YOGMA and catch the series premiere, this Wednesday 3/14 from 6-8pm alongside Seeds Series at the Chicago Cultural Center. 

Don't forget to RSVP on Eventbrite for free entry, link in event page: OTV Presents: SEEDS & Yogma Premiere.

Thank you #ShadowAndAct for shouting out Seeds Series (premiering 3/14) & Velvet Web Series (3/28)! 

To find all our premieres, check out our events: http://facebook.com/weareotv/events

Enjoy the official trailer for Velvet Web Series. Catch the premiere Wednesday, March 28th as a part of #OTVWednesdays: OTV Presents: The Exquisite Corpse & Velvet Premiere.

Happy #InternationalWomensDay! This cycle we have a whole host of bomb women filmmakers. VELVET is based on the rreal-lifefriendship between two of the shows co-creators, Allie Dunn and Tyla Landry, who met in 2016 as co-workers at a minority-owned financial firm in Chicago. 

When Demetra, a competitive professional, is forced to reevaluate her social life, she strikes up a friendship with Cymone, her seemingly much cooler coworker. As their worlds collide to form a brand new #squad, these five young Chicagoans begin to reevaluate their own identities as well as their relationships to each other. By weaving together public and private experiences, VELVET comedically explores the joys, vulnerabilities, and everything in-betweens of making new friends in your mid-twenties.

Thank you Brown Girl Magazine for recognizing #GeetasGuide! We will have NEW episodes coming in April! 

“I want to see more imperfect brown women....It’s about talking about the things that are dark in our communities,” Puja Mohindra explained. “It’s about finding beauty in the messiness of life.” Geeta’s Guide serves as one of the first steps toward realistic South Asian female representation, and it’s a worthy entry.”

Thank you to everyone who came out last night! Your generous spirit and open hearts are so appreciated by the artists and the OTV team. The kick-off exceeded our hopes and dreams. 

Thank you to the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago for hosting us, the Black Arts Initiative at Northwestern University & PeopleWho.Care for sponsoring, Mainstream Media, LLC, Humboldt House, ACRE TV, and Free Write Arts & Literacy for partnering with us. Special thanks to Eli Micky for designing the set and Chris Walker for his assistance. 

You can follow our upcoming events here: http://facebook.com/weareotv/events or by assigning up for our cute little newsletter at http://www.weareo.tv. 

Special thanks to our artists Karan Sunil (Code-Switched), Deja Harrell (Seeds Series) and Karla Huffman (YOGMA) for their talent and generosity! 

Photo credit: Vasilios Papapitsios
